answerText: Wole Soyinka[10] This Soyinka play sees the title dictator demand a yam as part of the title tribute from the tribal Oba Danlola to signify his defeat.
heading: Illinois Fall Touranment |2012 | 5 | 17 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In one play by this author, Elesin Oba strangles himself after his son Olunde committed ritual suicide. For 10 points each: [10] Name this author of Death and the King's Horseman who depicted Baroka and Lukunle's rivalry over the girl Sidi in his The Lion and the Jewel.
